changes.content: tui: Required<Omit<TuiConfigOverride, 'theme'>> & { theme: { theme: PredefinedTheme; custom_theme?: ThemeOverride } };

src/config/schema.ts.purpose: Configuration schema definition with theme support

patterns_discovered.schema_design: Follows consistent interface naming pattern (ConfigOverride suffix)
patterns_discovered.import_organization: Imports are organized at the top of the file
patterns_discovered.type_safety: Uses Required<Omit<...>> & { ... } pattern for default config type

discoveries.approach_outcome: SUCCESS - Successfully added theme configuration interface to the schema with proper type constraints and default values
recommendations: The implementation follows good TypeScript practices with proper type constraints
The use of Omit to exclude the optional 'theme' property while maintaining required properties is well-done
Default values are appropriately structured with a default theme and optional custom overrides
